column4: does ubuntu require reboots to alter system changes like resolution?
I was not  atechie until I discovered Linux (in fact I'm still not, really)
the file system keeps things contiguous by itself
is it an ftp server crashing, or your client?
you mean command line ftp is crashing? i've never seen that...
erm - is it segfaulting? What errors?
that's what I meant by "which client"
yes, but it is nautilus that has the problem
not dumped - but there are other files managers of course ( e.g konqueror, rox-filer, etc etc )
nautilus is kind of integrated with gnome, so dumping it wouldn't be trivial :)
nautilus is what you see when you open a folder/directory
pine is "non-free" and not in Ubuntu
